text: <@U25PYL3Q8> is that integrated with HubSpot or do you have to transfer your css/js over? I have a similar setup with node that process and compresses my code but it's all in a local environment. That would be so cool if it was possible to have it directly sync to HubSpot!
<@U7G631G5P> I have a setup that ftps using gulp to the server, but syncing is very difficult and messy. If you are a lone wolf on an account, it works
Very cool! Yeah it's not a huge trouble for me to copy and paste to HubSpot but interesting to know this can be done.
FTP into HubSpot is not awesome.

<!here> I am setting up a custom static form with an Ajax request. Problem is CORS - I setup the hs_context with the redirectUrl and I get a 302 response code but CORS is blocking the redirect.

Anyone have any workarounds?
Hmmm.  I’m not sure that I love the idea, but I have used the cors-anywhere herokuapp before.
I believe that you can do something like ‘//cors-anywhere.herokuapp.com/ + your.url’
IT is not, and it is troublesome.
Ever have to open up every website page or landing page to edit them all???  WELL paste this into the console and it will open them all for you on that page

<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F7HAZ4EF5/open_the_10_pages_inside_your_website_pages_landing_pages.js|open the 10 pages inside your website pages/landing pages>
will probblay work for blogs also
much easier than command clicking each one
I'm sure we could take it one step farther and get it to the edit page
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F7HB1K05R/edit_all_10_pages.js|Edit all 10 pages>
that one goes right into edit

i just did somthing similar for a list  of like 300 clients. I scraped the whole site with javascript and downloaded all of the images and text with javascript so I could copy and past that from console into a csv and upload into hubdb
3 hour job turned into 20 minute job
nice!
This is awesome
Javascript saves the day
you guys check out my proof of concept for HubSpot importer / from wordpress?
<http://hubapi.nickdeckerdevs.com/wordpress-test.php>
after it loads up, you can paste a url at the bottom, really only loads content between <article></article>
then provides a url so you can see how it looks in a HubSpot template
Does anyone on have any experience with using the api to create timeline events?
Download all images from a certain container.
